result.execSummary:
The defendant David R Schmiedlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant David R Schmiedlin in court with Attorney David P. Geraghty.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant ordered to serve FOUR (4) months in the House of Correction STRAIGHT TIME.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for SIX (6) months with the following conditions:

*Restitution of $500 to be paid to victim, Lori D.
*Operating privileges suspended for TWELVE (12) months.
*Pay fine in the amount of $300 to be paid while Defendant is on probation.  If not paid while on probation, will convert to a civil judgment.
*Defendant to pay the court costs and surcharges while on probation.  If not paid, will convert to a civil judgment.

AS TO COUNT #2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction with Huber release for work and electronic monitoring with the following condition:

*$300 fine plus costs and surcharges to be paid while on probation.  If not paid, will convert to civil judgment.
*Continue mental health treatment.

The Defendant has THIRTY (30) days to report to the House of Corrections.  Defendant has to report on December 17, 2015 but has option to report any time before December 17, 2015 by 5:00pm to start sentence earlier.

Filed,
Sentencing Referral Form (copy);
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
from Attorney David Geraghty dated 10/7/15 with attached letters from William stephen and Sarah Smith, received and filed.
received and filed.

Defendant David R Schmiedlin in court with Attorney David P. Geraghty.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea Heaing.  The State filed an AMENDED information, received and filed.  The Court VACATED the October 14, 2015 Jury Trial date.

AS TO COUNTS #1 AND #2:  Defendant advised of constitutional rights and of maximum penalties, waived all rights and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by state and defense to complaint as factual basis to sustain plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Matter set for sentencing on November 17, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Defendant David R Schmiedlin in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Francesco Mineo for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.
